intro: Eriocaulon damazianum, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowering structures consist of spikelets that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Eriocaulon damazianum plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
